Package org.jgroups.annotations.observability

Annotation Interface Observable

@Target({FIELD,METHOD}) @Retention(RUNTIME) public @interface Observable
Annotation to mark protocol fields or methods that should be exported as OpenTelemetry metrics. This annotation provides a declarative way to define metrics without writing boilerplate code.

Metric names are automatically prefixed with jgroups.{protocol}. where protocol is the lowercase protocol class name (e.g., UNICAST3 becomes jgroups.unicast3.).

Example usage:

 
 public class UNICAST3 extends Protocol {
     @Observable(name = "messages.sent",
                 type = ObservableType.COUNTER,
                 unit = ObservableUnit.MESSAGES,
                 description = "Total number of unicast messages sent")
     protected final LongAdder num_msgs_sent = new LongAdder();
     // Results in metric name: jgroups.unicast3.messages.sent
 }

The annotation can be applied to:

  • Fields (e.g., LongAdder, AtomicLong, primitive types)
  • Methods (e.g., getters that return metric values)
Author:
Radoslav Husar

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Required Element
    Description
    ObservableType
    type
    The type of metric to create (Counter, Gauge, Histogram, etc.).
    ObservableUnit
    unit
    The unit of measurement for this metric.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    String
    description
    An optional human-readable description of what this metric measures.
    String
    name
    The metric name suffix (without the jgroups.{protocol}. prefix).
    ObservableScope
    scope
    The scope of this metric, indicating whether it's runtime operational data or configuration.

  • Element Details

    • type

      ObservableType type
      The type of metric to create (Counter, Gauge, Histogram, etc.). This determines how OpenTelemetry will collect and aggregate the metric.
      Returns:
      The metric type

    • unit

      ObservableUnit unit
      The unit of measurement for this metric. Uses UCUM (Unified Code for Units of Measure) conventions.
      Returns:
      The unit type

    • name

      String name
      The metric name suffix (without the jgroups.{protocol}. prefix). The full metric name will be jgroups.{protocol}.{name}.

      If not specified, a name will be derived from the field/method name (e.g., num_msgs_sent becomes num.msgs.sent).

      Example: name = "messages.sent" in UNICAST3 becomes jgroups.unicast3.messages.sent

      Returns:
      The metric name suffix (without protocol prefix)
      Default:
      ""

    • description

      String description
      An optional human-readable description of what this metric measures. This will be included in the metric metadata.
      Returns:
      The metric description
      Default:
      ""

    • scope

      ObservableScope scope
      The scope of this metric, indicating whether it's runtime operational data or configuration.

      ObservableScope.RUNTIME metrics are always exported and represent dynamic protocol behavior (e.g., message counts, queue sizes, active connections).

      ObservableScope.CONFIGURATION metrics are only exported when the exposeConfigurationMetrics option is enabled on the OPENTELEMETRY protocol. These represent protocol settings and thresholds (e.g., min/max bounds, capacity limits, enabled/disabled flags).

      Default is ObservableScope.RUNTIME.

      Returns:
      The metric scope
      Default:
      RUNTIME
